result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Thomas M McIntyre

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Thomas M McIntyre not in court, in custody.  Attorney Joseph R Kennedy in court for Thomas M McIntyre.  Assistant District Attorney Grant Ian Huebner in court for State of Wisconsin.   Also appearing via zoom is counsel for the victims, Attorney Stephanie Konstantatkis.  Parties are requesting dates for final pretrial and jury trial.  Case remains calendared in Br 45.  mn
Status hearing scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Final pre-trial scheduled for December 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for February 6, 2023 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Thomas M McIntyre not in court, in custody.  Attorney Joseph R Kennedy in court for Thomas M McIntyre.  Prosecuting attorney Grant Ian Huebner in court for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant's appearance waived.  Lab results have been received by the State and forwarded to defense.  Defense is requesting an adjourned scheduling date to review with client.  Case remains calendared in Br 45.  mn
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Judge Jean Kies, Br 45, room G55 in CJF

Attorney Joseph R Kennedy in court, defendant Thomas M McIntyre not in court, in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Awaiting lab results.  Status conference scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 08:45 am.

Defendant Thomas M McIntyre in court  by video with Attorney Glenn Gaskill who appears in person on behalf of Attorney Joseph R Kennedy.  Defendant Thomas M McIntyre in custody.  Grant Huebner appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 34, Judge Yamahiro. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 34. Scheduling conference scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Adjustment Number: 22A 057576,
Payable Number: 1014694,
Receipt Number: 22RP025014,
Amount: $20.00
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Thomas M McIntyre in court with Attorney Glenn Edward Gaskill for Atty Kennedy.  Defendant Thomas M McIntyre in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Thomas M McIntyre appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Yamahiro, Branch 34.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defense request to be heard on bail at the preliminary hearing.  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
